content.question: Which of the following best explains a characteristic of elections in Mexico and Nigeria?

choices.label: Mexico and Nigeria both have thresholds for parties to win seats in the legislature, which have reduced the number of parties that win seats.
Mexico and Nigeria both have rules that require the president to earn a minimum percentage of votes in each state, which has reduced the impact of regional differences upon electoral results.
Mexico and Nigeria both have single-member district (SMD) electoral systems, which increases the number of parties in the legislature.
Mexico and Nigeria both have independent electoral commissions to reduce the impact of corrupt practices upon election results.

content.answer: Mexico and Nigeria both have independent electoral commissions to reduce the impact of corrupt practices upon election results.
